channel.title: INtech
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtech, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: VP Debate Night: Vance Sanitized Trumpism, Walz Called Himself a Knucklehead
item.description: The WIRED politics team unpacks the first and only vice presidential debate of the 2024 election.

item.title: Players Are Turning the ‘Echoes’ in ‘The Legend of Zelda: Echoes of Wisdom’ Into Cheat Codes
item.description: Behold, my new flying machine: this table attached to a bird.

item.title: Pavel Durov Defends Telegram's Privacy Changes Amid User Unrest
item.description: After Telegram founder Pavel Durov’s arrest in France, the platform has made several changes that seemingly make it friendlier to authorities.

item.title: Elon Musk’s xAI moves into OpenAI’s old HQ
item.description: San Francisco’s Mission district isn’t known for corporate offices, but it’s now home to two of the world’s most well-funded AI startups. Elon Musk’s ...

item.title: Hurricane Helene Shows How Broken the US Insurance System Is
item.description: Many homeowners in North Carolina won’t be insured against flooding or landslides due to the fragmented way in which disasters are covered.

item.title: Four-legged robot learns to climb ladders
item.description: The proliferation of robots like Boston Dynamics’ Spot has showcased the versatility of quadrupeds. These systems have thrived at walking up stairs, t...

item.title: Venture firm CRV returns $275 million citing overvaluation of mature startups
item.description: CRV, a more than 50-year-old venture firm, is returning to investors $275 million from its $500 million Select fund, which backs later-stage rounds of...

item.title: Hacking Generative AI for Fun and Profit

item.title: Judge blocks California’s new AI law in case over Kamala Harris deepfake
item.description: A federal judge blocked one of California’s new AI laws on Wednesday, less than two weeks after it was signed by Governor Gavin Newsom. Shortly after ...

item.title: Meta confirms it may train its AI on any image you ask Ray-Ban Meta AI to analyze
item.description: We recently asked Meta if it trains AI on photos and videos that users take on the Ray-Ban Meta smart glasses. The company originally didn’t have much...
